content: sts bet markers rounds 19-34 repeat rounds 15-18 four more times repeating lozenge cable chart after round 23 53 sts total round 35 place 13 sts on holder or waste yarn remove 2nd with 13 gusset sts bet markers marker at end of gusset keep end-of-round marker in place use backward loop method to cast on 1 st over gap left by removed round 35 work in patt to first gusset marker remove marker gusset sts this stitch will be knit in all subsequent rounds work in place 13 sts on holder or waste yarn remove second gusset patt to end of round 41 sts divided as 20 knit sts 16 chart sts and marker also the end-of-round marker temporarily use the 5 knit sts backward loop method to cast on 1 st over gap left by removed gusset sts this stitch will be knit in all subsequent rounds upper right hand replace end-of-round marker 41 sts divided as 5 knit sts rounds 36-45 cont in est patt ending with row 22 of the 2nd 16 chart sts and 20 knit sts chart repeat upper left hand round 46 row 23 of the 2nd chart repeat k16 k2tog k2 work rounds 36-45 cont in est patt ending with row 22 of the row 23 of the chart k5 40 sts 2nd chart repeat change to smaller needles and begin ribbing k2 p2 4 times k3 round 46 row 23 of the 2nd chart repeat k5 work row 23 p1 k2 p2 3 times k2 p1 k3 p2 40 sts of the chart k2 k2tog knit to marker 40 sts cont in patt for 0 75 /2 cm bobble in patt change to smaller needles and begin ribbing p2 k3 p1 right thumb k2 p2 3 times k2 p1 k3 p2 k2 4 times 40 sts place held gusset sts onto 3 smaller dpns join yarn leaving a long cont in patt for 0 75 /2 cm bobble in patt tail pick up and knit one st in co st at base of upper hand over gap left thumb and join to work in the round 14 sts work left thumb in same fashion as right thumb with larger dpns knit 2 rounds cont with larger dpns work ribbing *k1 p1 repeat from* to end of round finishing cont in patt for 0 75 /2 cm bobble in patt loosely weave in tails closing gaps at base of thumb with long tail block to finished measurements so that cable section is expanded to see the purl sts in columns 1 and 16 of the chart page 2 all images text and illustration copyright chief left hand knits llc march 2014 revised october 2015 the charts the lozenge cable chart is worked in the round by reading each chart row right to left the 16-stitch chart row is worked once in each round of the wrist warmer row 1-23 are repeated once lozenge cable written instructions for lozenge cable row 1 p1
